page.title: 07REFUSE DISPOSAL
page.content: Eighty_eight thousand people in the Malvern area put their refuse in the Hanley Swan incinerator.Each refuse lorry takes diesel and fifteen lorries come every day to the incinerator.This nine hundred degrees Centigrade furnace burns around the clock,and cans and bottles come out of the bottom of the furnace on to the counveyer belt into a container.The lorries come and pick the ash up and take it to the tip .They clean out the silos every two weeks and it is done by hand ,and the men have to wear masks so that they don't catch a disease from the refuse. The furnace hall houses two furnaces, each rated for burning two tons per hour. The furnaces receive the refuse from the feed hopper. The men work an average of eighty hours a week.
